ISB200.name: History of Life
ISB200.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
ISB200.description: Life from its origin to the dawn of human history. Living things as both the products of evolutionary processes and as a major force driving evolution and altering the environment of planet earth.
ISB200.prerequisite: ((MTH 101 or concurrently) or (MTH 103 or concurrently) or (MTH 103B or concurrently) or (MTH 116 or concurrently) or (MTH 124 or concurrently) or (MTH 132 or concurrently) or (MTH 201 or concurrently) or (LB 118 or concurrently) or (STT 200 or concurrently) or (STT 201 or concurrently)) or designated score on Mathematics Placement test

ISB201.name: Insects, Globalization, and Sustainability
ISB201.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
ISB201.description: The relationship between insects, human society, and the environment with an emphasis on ecological and evolutionary processes. Critical evaluation of current regional and global environmental problems and how they are effecting the development of a sustainable society.
ISB201.prerequisite: ((MTH 101 or concurrently) or (MTH 103 or concurrently) or (MTH 103B or concurrently) or (MTH 116 or concurrently) or (MTH 124 or concurrently) or (MTH 132 or concurrently) or (MTH 201 or concurrently) or (LB 118 or concurrently) or (STT 200 or concurrently) or (STT 201 or concurrently)) or designated score on Mathematics Placement test

ISB201L.name: Insects, Globalization, and Sustainability Laboratory
ISB201L.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
ISB201L.description: Problem-based learning activities involved with observing, hypothesizing, experimenting, and analysis of data related to environmental science.

ISB202.name: Applications of Environmental and Organismal Biology
ISB202.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
ISB202.description: Historical and recent development of ideas about behavior, ecological, and evolutionary processes. Critical evaluation of the use and misuse of human understanding of nature, emphasizing recent findings.
ISB202.prerequisite: ((MTH 101 or concurrently) or (MTH 103 or concurrently) or (MTH 103B or concurrently) or (MTH 116 or concurrently) or (MTH 124 or concurrently) or (MTH 132 or concurrently) or (MTH 201 or concurrently) or (LB 118 or concurrently) or (STT 200 or concurrently) or (STT 201 or concurrently)) or designated score on Mathematics Placement test

ISB204.name: Applications of Biomedical Sciences
ISB204.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
ISB204.description: Historical and recent development of knowledge about cellular developmental or genetic processes. Critical evaluation of the use and misuse of scientific discoveries in these areas.
ISB204.prerequisite: ((MTH 101 or concurrently) or (MTH 103 or concurrently) or (MTH 103B or concurrently) or (MTH 116 or concurrently) or (MTH 124 or concurrently) or (MTH 132 or concurrently) or (MTH 201 or concurrently) or (LB 118 or concurrently) or (STT 200 or concurrently) or (STT 201 or concurrently)) or designated score on Mathematics Placement test

ISB208L.name: Applications in Biological Science Laboratory
ISB208L.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
ISB208L.description: Problem solving activities based on observation and interpretation of selected biological systems.
